articles.title: ANALYSIS-Argentina primary defeat puts Peronists in tough spot on policy
articles.description: It lost in its key stronghold of Buenos Aires province, which surrounds the capital. If the results for the primaries are repeated in the November midterm vote, the ruling party would lose control of the Senate and its leading minority position in the lower Chamber of Deputies, analysts say.
articles.content:
Argentina's Peronists are caught between a rock and a hard place after a crushing defeat in midterm congressional primaries on Sunday: shift to the center to win back crossover voters or double down on populist policies to fire up the base.

articles.title: Argentine farmers urge govt to review export caps, taxes after election defeat
articles.description: By Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, Sept 13 (Reuters) - Argentina's farming leaders on Monday called on the government to review what they called interventionist policies in the sector, including export caps on beef and grains taxes, following a primary election that badly bruised the ruling party.President Alberto Fernandez's center-left government was badly beaten

articles.title: Argentina's markets rise after Peronists bruised in primary vote
articles.description: Argentina's bond and equities markets rallied in early trading on Monday after the country's Peronist government suffered a bruising result in primary elections over the weekend.

articles.title: Argentina shaken by 6.2 magnitude earthquake Monday
articles.description: According to the U.S. Geological Survey, Argentina was shaken by an earthquake with a magnitude of 6.2 early Monday.

articles.title: Argentina opposition leads in key seats in congressional primaries, early results show
articles.description: Argentina's main opposition party held leads in the country's capital and the important province of Buenos Aires in congressional primary elections on Sunday, early results showed, indicating a strong challenge to the ruling Peronist coalition.

articles.title: Fact-checking works to undercut misinformation in many countries
articles.description: From Argentina to Nigeria, fact-checks limited false beliefs.
articles.content: In the wake of the flood of misinformation that's drowning the US, lots of organizations have turned to fact-checks. Many newsrooms set up dedicated fact-check groups, and some independent organizations were formed to provide the service. We get live... [4927 chars]
